{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3168909,"name":"Vincent Zhao","username":"vzhao768","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/b4bc9f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-20T21:37:20.479Z","cooked":"

The way that our team chooses our auton paths during our competition is having a sendable chooser published to smart dashboard with each of our auto commands linked to one of the options.

This system was working throughout our entire competition until elims where shuffleboard returned the default option rather than the selected one. This happened during one match, then in pits we restarted shuffleboard and the selector worked again, but in the next match drive team restarted shuffleboard, selected and still the wrong path ran. After that match, in pits we couldn’t get the selector to work at all even after restarting shuffleboard.

Does anyone know why this happened, how to fix it or any alternative ways to choose auton paths?

Make sure you’re on the latest version of WPILIB, including Shuffleboard. There have been some important fixes to NetworkTables.

We’ve been using version 2023.4.2 and the latest roborio image.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-03-20T23:13:56.718Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":18.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431025,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-sendable-chooser-stopped-working-during-elims","display_username":"Vincent Zhao","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38743,"username":"bovlb","name":"Gavin Matthews","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49824,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"115 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-sendable-chooser-stopped-working-during-elims/431025/3","custom_user_title":"115 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3169010,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-20T23:24:42.957Z","cooked":"

A couple of questions:

  • Did shuffleboard show the robot as confirming the change? The GUI shows either an X or a checkmark next to the drop-down. If a checkmark is shown that means the robot code has echo’ed back the same value as what’s been selected in the drop-down, and calling getSelected in code will return that value. If X is shown that means that for whatever reason the code is not echo’ing back the change.
  • Where are you calling the SendableChooser.getSelected() from? Are you printing that value? I’m looking to break down the problem into whether getSelected() is returning the wrong value, or whether the code is doing the wrong thing (e.g. wrong path) with the correct value.
  • Are you still able to reproduce the issue with your robot at home? It would seem likely you should be able to do so since it sounds like it was still happening in the pits.

There are many alternatives to using SendableChooser. For example, you can read button presses in disabled mode, so you could use different buttons to select different auto modes, or even use up/down buttons for an unlimited number. You can echo the selection back however you like, e.g. printing or displaying just as a string to the dashboard.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-03-20T23:25:54.986Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":85,"readers_count":84,"score":22.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431025,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-sendable-chooser-stopped-working-during-elims","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-sendable-chooser-stopped-working-during-elims/431025/4","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3169046,"name":"Vincent Zhao","username":"vzhao768","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/b4bc9f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-21T00:17:27.887Z","cooked":"
  • The GUI was showing a checkmark in pits, I don’t know exactly what drive saw.
  • We call getSelected in autonInit(), we aren’t currently printing the value
  • I will let you know once we get back to the lab.

Thank you for the suggestions, we will try some of those out before our next competition if we can’t solve this shuffleboard issue!

If you want to go old school, you can use something like this. This could be onboard the robot (using DIO pins on the RIO), or part of the driver station (this would require a button board controller). You can do the same thing with one or more regular switches – the idea is you use a type of switch which you can set before the match which will hold their position (unlike a pushbutton).
